p: We live in a “sea” of viruses known as the human virome ( Lecuit and Eloit, 2013). Viruses are integral to life itself; they are nature's way of ensuring “survival of the fittest”. They constantly probe the immune system defenses of the body. If the immune system is healthy, the viruses are neutralized. If the immune system is degraded/dysfunctional, pathogenic viruses can invade the cells, replicate, and trigger a chain of events leading to clinically manifested infectious disease.
